lines.content: I used **GitHub Copilot Pro** to assist me with the iP project.
- Used autocomplete feature for method implementations based on method names alone
- Leveraged suggestions for common patterns (e.g., exception handling, validation logic)
- Accepted and modified suggestions to fit the specific requirements of the project
- Asked Copilot to suggest architecture decisions
- E.g: The module allocation of classes
- Requested suggestions for refactoring code to improve maintainability through class decomposition and separation of
- Asked Copilot to refactor methods when there are changes in signatures or constructors
- E.g: Refactoring the HelpCommand to accommodate changes in the constructor parameters
- Used AI agent to ensure that all references to the modified method were updated accordingly
- Used AI agent to refactor all the javadoc comments to reflect my newfound knowledge in Code Quality
- Asked Copilot to fix compilation errors
- Asked Copilot to identify the sources of runtime errors and how to resolve them
- **Precise tasks**: Specific, well-defined tasks like "create a way to parse X" or "refactor method Y to use Z from A,
- **70% completion**: Takes me most of the way there quickly
- **Pattern recognition**: Good at suggesting standard SWE patterns that I have not known myself, such as
- **Refactoring**: Effective for mechanical refactoring (renaming, moving code)
- **Many rules**: When there are a lot of restrictions or requirements, it can struggle to keep track of them all, and
then violate them. In this case, I would have to come in to hand code the solution.
- **FXML stuff**: I found that Copilot was not very good at generating FXML code, and I had to hand code it myself most
of the time, probably because it is not a very common language, and there are not many examples of it in the training
- **Almost there only**: AI is very good at getting me to the solution, but it always requires some manual tweaking to
get it to work. And sometimes, the solution it suggested has so many errors that I have to spend equal amount of time
- **Env and configs**: AI is not good at generating environment and configuration files, such as .gitignore,
# I would like to join this list. How can I help the project
For more information, please refer to our [contributor's guide](https://oss-generic.github.io/process/).

Ello is a task management chatbot to help you organize your tasks efficiently. Whether you're a student,
professional, with Ello, you can easily add, view, and manage your tasks using simple commands.
1. Ensure you have Java 17 or above installed.
3. Copy the file to an empty folder.
4. Open a terminal, navigate `cd` to the folder, and run:
Add a simple task to your list.
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 1 Task in the list.
Add a task with a specific deadline.
- Date-only formats (time defaults to start of day): `d/M/yyyy`, `dd/MM/yyyy`, `yyyy-MM-dd`
Got it. I've added this task:
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Add a task that starts and ends at specific times.
Got it. I've added this task:
[E][ ] Team meeting (from: Feb 19 2026, 9:30 PM to: Feb 19 2026, 10:30 PM)
Now you have 3 tasks in the list.
Display all tasks in your list.
Here are the tasks in your list:
3. [E][ ] Team meeting (from: Feb 19 2026, 9:30 PM to: Feb 19 2026, 10:30 PM)
Nice! I've marked this task as done:
Mark a completed task as not done.
OK, I've marked this task as not done yet:
Remove a task from your list.
Now you have 2 tasks in the list.
Search for tasks containing specific keywords.
Here are the matching tasks in your list:
1. [E][ ] Team meeting (from: Feb 19 2026, 9:30 PM to: Feb 19 2026, 10:30 PM)
View a list of all available commands.
1. todo: Adds a todo task to the list
2. deadline: Adds a deadline task to the list
3. event: Adds an event task to the list
5. mark: Marks a task as done
6. unmark: Marks a task as not done
7. delete: Deletes a task from the list
8. find: Finds tasks containing the specified keyword
Type 'help <number>' to see detailed syntax for each command.
View detailed syntax for a specific command.
Close Ello and save your tasks.
Bye. Hope to see you again soon!
You would also expect the application to close after this command, and all your tasks to be saved for the next time you
| `todo <description>`                            | Adds a todo task to the list                 |
| `deadline <description> /by <value>`            | Adds a deadline task to the list             |
| `event <description> /from <value> /to <value>` | Adds an event task to the list               |
| `unmark <task_number>`                          | Marks a task as not done                     |
| `delete <task_number>`                          | Deletes a task from the list                 |
| `find <keyword>`                                | Finds tasks containing the specified keyword |
| `help <command_number>`                         | Shows detailed syntax for a specific command |
| `bye`                                           | Exits the application & Closes the window    |
This project uses JavaFX for the graphical user interface and Gson for JSON serialization. Artificial Intelligence (AI)
has been used to assist in this project: help to write JavaDoc comments, CSS styling, code refactoring, and

* Static utility class that encapsulates a configured Gson instance.
* Provides type-safe methods for serializing and deserializing objects.
* Serializes an object to a JSON string.
* @return A JSON string representation of the object.
* Deserializes a JSON string to a list of the specified element type.
* @param json         The JSON string to deserialize.
